近郊: outskirts, environs (of a city), surrounding area
ご馳走: treat (esp. food and drink), entertainment, treating someone (to a meal)
下: under (guidance, supervision, rules, the law, etc.), under (a flag, the sun, etc.), beneath
狂う: to go mad, to lose one's mind, to go crazy
人影: figure of a person, figures of people, shadow of a person
駅: railway station, train station, staging post on a highway (in pre-modern Japan)
鞠: ball (for sport, games, etc.); kemari, type of football played by courtiers in ancient Japan
子供の頃: (time of) one's childhood, when one was a child
郡: district, county, district (of 2-20 50-home neighbourhoods or townships, in the ritsuryō period)
臨む: to look out on, to overlook, to front onto
釣る: to fish, to angle, to catch
与える: to give (esp. to someone of lower status), to bestow, to grant
